meanings.sent1: She explained the concept using a parage between a tree and a family.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a parage to help the students understand the complex idea.
meanings.sent3: The parage between a bee and a flower made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His parage of life as a journey resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The parage of the human brain to a computer was fascinating.

meanings.sent1: I will parage the situation to a puzzle for better understanding.
meanings.sent2: She likes to parage different types of flowers to pieces of art.
meanings.sent3: He always parages his friends to characters in movies.
meanings.sent4: The author loves to parage nature to emotions in her poems.
meanings.sent5: Let's parage the growth of a plant to the development of a child.

meanings.sent1: The royal family's parage was well-known throughout the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She traced her parage back to a famous historical figure.
meanings.sent3: The parage of the ancient castle was a source of pride for the town.
meanings.sent4: His parage included knights and lords from centuries past.
meanings.sent5: The parage of the noble family was depicted in the grand portrait.
